author: cnbc.com
title: Williams-Sonoma tops Street 4Q forecasts
text:
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) _ Williams-Sonoma Inc. (WSM) on Wednesday reported fiscal fourth-quarter earnings of $95.8 million.
The San Francisco-based company said it had profit of $1.13 per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were $1.68 per share.
The results topped Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 14 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.63 per share.
The seller of cookware and home furnishings posted revenue of $1.68 billion in the period, which also beat Street forecasts. Eleven analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $1.65 billion.
For the year, the company reported profit of $259.5 million, or $3.02 per share. Revenue was reported as $5.29 billion.
For the current quarter ending in May, Williams-Sonoma expects its per-share earnings to range from 55 cents to 60 cents.
The company said it expects revenue in the range of $1.14 billion to $1.17 billion for the fiscal first quarter. Analysts surveyed by Zacks had expected revenue of $1.15 billion.
Williams-Sonoma expects full-year earnings in the range of $4.12 to $4.22 per share, with revenue ranging from $5.48 billion to $5.64 billion.
Williams-Sonoma shares have increased almost 4 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Wednesday, shares hit $53.70, a rise of 13 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on WSM at https://www.zacks.com/ap/WSM
